column4: Hi, I just tried updating 10-4 and it wanted but couldn't find several files for example logrotate.  Here's the url it wanted --
http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/l/logroate/logrotate_3.7.8-4ubuntu2.1_i386.deb
I had a look, and earlier and later logrotates are there but not 2.1
Any suggests on what I should do about my update?
s/suggest/&ion
any comments or thoughts on my update issue, logrotate et al, above?
Or is there a more appropriate channel for me to take the issue to?
So, you're saying the package is not there?
3.1 is the current version in 10.04, is there a reason you're looking for 2.1?
Or are you saying that apt was looking for 2.1?  (As far as I can tell, 2.1 never was in the 10.04 repositories, went from 2 to 3 to 3.1)
oh wait, I got mixed up somehow with versions.  10.04 had 2.1, and now it has 2.2.  Do you have -proposed enabled by any chance?
The easiest way for you and me is to just pastebin the output of `sudo apt-get update`
As far as I know, everything goes to stdout
the package is pastebinit
looks like there may be a repository issue.  Try disabling the source repositories and seeing if you can update again without the error
Thats a repository file though, from what it's saying.  I don't see how something you've done locally would affect it.  I'd try disabling source repos (temporarily) and seeing if it helps
Do you have a GUI on this box?
Are you more comfortable with config files?

alright, go ahead and edit /etc/apt/sources.list, and comment out all of the deb-src lines (keeping the deb lines), save the file, then apt-get update again.  You can also check in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*, but I don't think you'll find much, if anything, there.
Oh.  Question for you.  Do you have any xchat-specific repositories in that file, or in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/?
Just comment out the (xchat) line.  And sources.list.d being empty isn't a surprise, just one more place to look.
That'll work.  Looks like your xchat specific repository has some configuration issues.
